analyzed: ekasmin kule nihata tva devānām mahat rahasya ātmakam
translated: In one family, having been destroyed, it is the great secret of the gods.

original: kāyasyāsya prati kaṇe kaṇe kāya vā pūrṇataḥ pariṇata kṛtvā vajradhararūpeṇāvalokanameva kāyavivekaḥ /
analyzed: kāyasya asya prati kaṇe kaṇe vā pūrṇatas kṛtvā vajradhara rūpeṇa avalokanam eva kāya vivekaḥ
translated: In every particle of this body, or having fully transformed it into the form of Vajradhara, the mere looking is the discrimination of the body.

original: vyutpattiḥ kāyastu samūhabodhakaśśabdaḥ yatra śarīramāsāsthirūdhirādinaikadharmāṇā samūhastatraiva cittamapi pūrvaparādikṣaṇānā samūhaḥ /
analyzed: vyutpattiḥ kāyaḥ tu samūha bodhakaḥ śabdaḥ yatra śarīra māsa asthi rūdhira ādinā eka dharmāṇā samūhaḥ tatra eva cittam api pūrva para ādi kṣaṇānā samūhaḥ
translated: The derivation is that the word body indicates a collection. Where there is a collection of the single dharmas of bones, flesh, blood, etc., in the body, there the mind also is a collection of the moments of past, present, and future.

analyzed: atoya kāya ucyate
translated: Therefore, this is called the body.

original: sāmānyakāyadṛṣṭyā uparilikhitadevasamūhasya bhāvanayā sāmānyābhāsaḥ abhiniveśakṣayaśca bhavati /
analyzed: sāmānya kāya dṛṣṭyā upari likhita deva samūhasya bhāvanayā sāmānya ābhāsaḥ abhiniveśa kṣayaḥ ca bhavati
translated: By the view of the general body, by the meditation on the multitude of gods written above, there is the appearance of the general and the destruction of attachment.

analyzed: atoya vivekaḥ samabhihitaḥ
translated: Therefore, this discrimination is stated equally.

analyzed: śāstreṣu kāya viveka vyutpattiḥ nyarūpyata
translated: Thus, the derivation of the discrimination of the body is shown in the treatises.

analyzed: kāya viveka sādhakaḥ vairocana dharma āsana vidhāya upaviśet
translated: The means of accomplishing the discrimination of the body is to sit in the posture of Vairocana Dharma.

analyzed: etat āsane pādau vajrāsane
translated: In this posture, the feet are in the vajra posture.

analyzed: hastau samāhita mudrāyā  kaśerūkā pṛṣṭha asthi  sāralye prasṛta vakṣaḥ
translated: The hands are in the samahita mudra.🔽The spine is straight.🔽The chest is expanded.

analyzed: kaṇṭhaḥ kiñcid avanataḥ  jihvā tālu spṛśantī
translated: The neck is slightly bent.🔽The tongue touches the palate.

analyzed: aoṣṭhau vivṛtau
translated: The lips are slightly open.

analyzed: cakṣuṣī ca nāsikā pradeśena paśyetām
translated: The eyes should look straight ahead at the tip of the nose.

original: imāḥ sapta sthitayaḥ vairocanasya sapta dharmāsanāni /
analyzed: imāḥ sapta sthitayaḥ vairocanasya sapta dharmāsanāni
translated: These seven postures are the seven Dharma seats of Vairocana.

original: vajrāsanakaraṇena apānavāyuḥ svādhikṛto bhavati /🔽samāhitamudrāyā sasthitasya nābhau prabhāvitāyā satyāmagniśśānto bhavati /
analyzed: vajrāsana karaṇena apāna vāyuḥ svādhikṛtaḥ bhavati  samāhita mudrāyā sasthitasya nābhau prabhāvitāyā satyām agniḥ śāntaḥ bhavati
translated: By the practice of the vajra posture, the apana breath becomes controlled.🔽When the samahita mudra is performed and the navel is energized, the fire becomes pacified.

original: kaśerūkāyāḥ ṛjutayā vyānavāyuradhikriyate /🔽bhujayoḥ saralatayā vakṣasaśca prasṛtatvena prāṇavāyuradhikṛto bhavati /
analyzed: kaśerūkāyāḥ ṛju tayā vyāna vāyuḥ adhikriyate  bhujayoḥ sarala tayā vakṣasaḥ ca prasṛta tvena prāṇa vāyuḥ adhikṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: By the straightness of the spine, the vyana wind becomes controlled.🔽By the straightness of the arms and the expansion of the chest, the prana wind becomes controlled.

original: kaṇṭhe avanate sati jihvāyāśca tālu pratyabhimukhatvād udānavāyuḥ vaśībhavati /
analyzed: kaṇṭhe avanate sati jihvāyāḥ ca tālu pratyabhimukha tvāt udāna vāyuḥ vaśībhavati
translated: When the neck is bent and the tongue faces the palate, the udana wind becomes subdued.

original: atra vajrāsanamanuṣṭhāya cittamavadhūtyāḥ adhobhāgasthamaṇicakrasya madhye āyudhe sūkṣmatilake vā ekāgratvena vidadhyāt /
analyzed: atra vajrāsanam anuṣṭhāya cittam avadhūtyāḥ adhobhāga stha maṇi cakrasya madhye āyudhe sūkṣma tilake vā ekāgra tvena vidadhyāt
translated: Here, having practiced the vajra posture, one should focus the mind on the weapon or the subtle mark in the center of the jewel chakra located below the navel.

original: eva karaṇena vāyucittayoḥ praveśasāmyena etadabhinnatvena ca sarvavāyavo'pi avadhūteradhobhāgasthe nāḍīcakre sagṛhyante /
analyzed: eva karaṇena vāyu cittayoḥ praveśa sāmyena etad abhinna tvena ca sarva vāyavaḥ api avadhūteḥ adhobhāga sthe nāḍī cakre sagṛhyante
translated: By this very instrument, by the equality of the entry of air and mind, by the non-difference of this, all the airs are also grasped in the cakra of nāḍīs located below the navel.

original: vāyuśca krameṇa madhyamāyā praviśya lābha prāpnoti /
analyzed: vāyuḥ ca krameṇa madhyamāyā praviśya lābha prāpnoti
translated: And the air gradually enters the madhyamā and attains gain.

original: pariṇāmataḥ nāsikāyāḥ chidradvayena vāyuḥ samānatayā vahati /
analyzed: pariṇāmataḥ nāsikāyāḥ chidra dvayena vāyuḥ samāna tayā vahati
translated: By transformation, the air flows through the two holes of the nose as the samāna.

original: madhyamānāḍyā vāyau sthite sati śvāsapraśvāsā avarūdhyante /
analyzed: madhyamānāḍyā vāyau sthite sati śvāsa praśvāsāḥ avarūdhyante
translated: When the air is located in the madhyamā nāḍī, inhalation and exhalation are obstructed.

analyzed: marīci prabhṛti lakṣaṇāni ca āvirbhavanti
translated: And the characteristics beginning with the rays become manifest.

original: avagaterūdgatikrame parivartanavidhiḥ vāyoḥ madhyamāyā praveśasthitisamutthāpanādināom āḥ hū iti tryakṣareṇa svaghoṣasvarūpavajrajāpāśrayaṇena hṛdayasya ūrdhvādhobhāgasthanāḍīcakreṣu śithileṣu satsu uparyyadhaḥ sthitāḥ sarvavāyavaḥ avadhūtau vilīyante /
analyzed: avagateḥ ūdgati krame parivartana vidhiḥ vāyoḥ madhyamāyā praveśa sthiti samutthāpana ādinā om āḥ hū iti tri akṣareṇa sva ghoṣa svarūpa vajra jāpa āśrayaṇena hṛdayasya ūrdhva adhas bhāga stha nāḍī cakreṣu śithileṣu satsu upari adhas sthitāḥ sarva vāyavaḥ avadhūtau vilīyante
translated: When the process of rising is understood, the method of reversal is by the entry, abiding, and arising of the air in the madhyamā, by resorting to the repetition of the three-syllabled mantra Oṃ āḥ hūṃ which is the nature of one's own voice and vajra, and when the cakras of nāḍīs located above and below the heart are relaxed, all the airs located above and below dissolve into the avadhūtī.

analyzed: tadā āloka jñānam udeti
translated: Then the knowledge of light arises.

analyzed: tad avasthāyām kāya viveka vāc vivekayoḥ parivartana jāyate
translated: In that state, the reversal of the separation of the body and the separation of speech takes place.

analyzed: vāc vivekaḥ prāṇāyāmam āśritya vāyu mantrayoḥ abhinna yogena grāhya grāhaka vikalpa nāśaka śaikṣika santati yogaḥ tu vāyu vivekaḥ
translated: The discrimination of speech, based on breath control, is the yogic practice of the trainee that destroys the discrimination of object and subject through the non-dual union of breath and mantra.

original: vāyusvarūpa mantraniyatārthañca buddhvā prāṇavāyusahita pramukhavāyūnā madhyamāyā praveśasthitistadutthāpito yoga eva vāgvivekaḥ /
analyzed: buddhvā prāṇa vāyu sahita pramukha vāyūnā madhyamāyā praveśa sthitiḥ tad utthāpitaḥ yogaḥ eva vāc vivekaḥ
translated: Understanding the nature of breath and the fixed meaning of mantra, the entry, abiding, and arising of the central channel along with the vital breath is itself the discrimination of speech.

analyzed: etat hṛdaya nāsikā agre anāhata tilaka bhāvanā mukha nāsikā agre ca raśmi tilaka bhāvanā
translated: The meditation on the unstruck sound at the tip of the heart and nose, and the meditation on the rays at the tip of the mouth and nose,

original: guhyanāsikāgre tu dravyatilakabhāvanā ceti sthānabhedena vāgvivekasya bhedatrayam /
analyzed: guhya nāsikā agre tu dravya tilaka bhāvanā ca iti sthāna bhedena vāc vivekasya bheda trayam
translated: and the meditation on the substance at the tip of the secret and nose - thus, the discrimination of speech is threefold based on the difference in locations.

original: sādhanā hṛdayanāsikāyā sūkṣmatilakabhāvanāvadhau hṛdayāṣṭadalanāḍīcakrasya bahiḥ ālokabodhakadvādaśakṣarāṇi śvetavarṇe /
analyzed: sādhanā hṛdaya nāsikāyāḥ sūkṣma tilaka bhāvanā avadhau hṛdaya aṣṭadala nāḍī cakrasya bahis āloka bodhaka dvādaśa kṣarāṇi śveta varṇe
translated: The means are the meditation on the subtle dot at the end of the heart and nose, outside the eight-petaled channel wheel of the heart, the twelve syllables that illuminate the light are white in color.

original: madhye ca mākṣara hitvā ālokābhāsabodhakavyañjanāni raktavarṇe /
analyzed: madhye ca mā akṣara hitvā āloka ābhāsa bodhaka vyañjanāni rakta varṇe
translated: And in the middle, leaving out the syllable ma, the consonants that illuminate the appearance of light are red in color.

original: ṛ lṛ prabhṛti catuḥsvarān kṛṣṇavarṇe bhāvayet /
analyzed: ṛ lṛ prabhṛti catur svarān kṛṣṇa varṇe bhāvayet
translated: One should meditate on the four vowels beginning with ṛ as black in color.

original: sarvākṣarāṇi tilakena vibhūṣya tanmadhye sthitānāhatatilakahṛsvākāre cittasvarūpeṇa avatiṣṭheta /
analyzed: sarva akṣarāṇi tilakena vibhūṣya tad madhye citta svarūpeṇa avatiṣṭheta
translated: Having adorned all the syllables with the tilaka, he should remain in the middle of them, in the form of the mind, in the shape of the unstruck tilaka.

analyzed: anāhata bindu sahitam akṣara maṇḍalam eva cittam
translated: The circle of syllables, along with the unstruck bindu, is the mind itself.

analyzed: evam ekāgra tā vidhāya prāṇāyāmam kuryāt
translated: Having thus concentrated, he should perform prāṇāyāma.

original: mantratilakadṛdatāprāptyanantara mukhanāsikāgre anāhatatilaka bhāvayet prāṇāyāmadvārā vajra japet /
analyzed: mukha nāsikā agre anāhata tilaka bhāvayet prāṇāyāma dvārā japet
translated: After attaining the mantra tilaka and the state of the heart, he should visualize the unstruck tilaka at the tip of the mouth and nose, and perform vajra recitation through prāṇāyāma.

analyzed: tadānīm tri akṣara ghoṣaḥ svayam eva udeti
translated: At that time, the sound of the three syllables arises by itself.

analyzed: eva manasā śṛṇvan vajra japam kuryāt
translated: Listening to it with the mind, he should perform vajra recitation.

original: mukhanāsikāgre pūrvavartiprāṇāyāmavidhidvayena yo vāyuḥ hṛdayakamale sagrahītumaśakyo'bhavat tasya haṭhayogabalena avadhūtyā adhonāsikāyā sūkṣmatilakālambana bhāvana ca vidhāya prāṇāyāmadvārā sagrahītu śakyate /
analyzed: mukha nāsikā agre pūrva varti prāṇāyāma vidhi dvayena yaḥ vāyuḥ hṛdaya kamale tasya haṭha yoga balena avadhūtyā adhas nāsikāyā sūkṣma tilaka ālambana bhāvana ca vidhāya prāṇāyāma dvārā śakyate
translated: By the two methods of prāṇāyāma previously performed at the tip of the mouth and nose, the air that became incapable of being grasped in the lotus of the heart, by the power of hatha yoga, is expelled downwards through the nostrils, and by visualizing the subtle tilaka, it becomes capable of being grasped through prāṇāyāma.

original: sārāśatastu vajrajāpasya pramukhasādhanāyā pañcajñānamayaśvāsan piṇḍarūpeṇa nāsikāyāmavasthāpya prāṇāyāmo vidhīyate /
analyzed: piṇḍa rūpeṇa nāsikāyām avasthāpya prāṇāyāmaḥ vidhīyate
translated: The prāṇāyāma is performed by establishing the breath consisting of the five knowledges in the form of a ball in the nose, which is the principal means of the hundred vajra recitations.

analyzed: etat eva pradhāna kṛtyam
translated: This is the primary duty.

analyzed: sthāna bhedena asya bhāvanā na eka sthāneṣu kriyate
translated: Its cultivation is not done in one place, but in different places.

analyzed: vāc vivekaḥ prāṇāyāmasya eva aṅga bhūtaḥ
translated: Thus, the discrimination of speech is an auxiliary to breath control.

original: etat sāhāyyena lalanārasanayoḥ pravahamānaḥ karmavāyurmadhyamāyā praviśati /
analyzed: etat sāhāyyena lalanā rasanayoḥ pravahamānaḥ karma vāyuḥ madhyamāyā praviśati
translated: With this assistance, the karmic wind flowing through the mouths of women enters the middle [channel].

analyzed: guhya samāja uttara tantre ca api pañca jñāna maya śvāsa pañcabhūta svabhāvakam
translated: And in the Guhyasamaja Uttaratantra, it is also said: The breath consisting of the five wisdoms has the nature of the five elements.

analyzed: niścārya piṇḍa rūpeṇa nāsikā agre tu kalpayet
translated: Having emitted it, imagine it in the form of a ball at the tip of the nose.

analyzed: pañca varṇa mahā ratna prāṇāyāmam iti smṛtam
translated: The five-colored great jewel is known as pranayama.

original: hṛdaye anāhatabindau cittasthityā kṣitijalāgniprabhṛtidhātavaḥ kramaśaḥ vilīyanta eva /
analyzed: hṛdaye anāhatabindau citta sthityā kṣiti jala agni prabhṛti dhātavaḥ kramaśas vilīyante eva
translated: In the unstruck sound bindu in the heart, by the stability of the mind, the elements such as earth, water, fire, etc. gradually dissolve.

analyzed: ante ca cittam api advaye avatiṣṭhate
translated: And in the end, the mind also rests in the non-dual.

analyzed: tad balena marīci dhūma dīpaka śikhāsu accha ākāśa ādīnām iva lakṣaṇāni samutpadyante
translated: By its power, the characteristics arise like the rays of the sun, smoke, the flame of a lamp, clear sky, etc.

original: avagaterūdgatiparivartanavidhiḥ bāhyābhyantaramudrāvajrajāpādyupāyānā sāhāyyena hṛdayanāḍīcakragranthiṣu samudghaṭitāsu sampūrṇo vyānavāyuḥ hṛdayakamalasthānāhatabindau vilīyate tadā''lokajñāna prakāśate vāgvivekaḥ cittaviveke saṅkramate /
analyzed: avagateḥ ūdgati parivartana vidhiḥ sāhāyyena hṛdaya nāḍī cakra granthiṣu samudghaṭitāsu sampūrṇaḥ vyāna vāyuḥ hṛdaya kamala sthāna āhata bindau vilīyate prakāśate vāc vivekaḥ citta viveke saṅkramate
translated: The method of opening the knots of the heart, channels, and cakras with the help of external and internal mudras, vajra recitation, and other means, when the complete vyana wind dissolves into the bindu struck in the lotus of the heart, then the knowledge of light dawns, the discrimination of speech moves into the discrimination of mind.

original: cittavivekaḥ bāhyamudrāyāḥ ābhyantaraprāṇāyāmasya ca balena mūlasahitāḥ same'pi daśavāyavo hṛdayasthānāhatabindau tathaiva tiṣṭhanti yathā ca mṛtyukāle dhātavo vilīyante /
analyzed: citta vivekaḥ bāhya mudrāyāḥ ābhyantara prāṇāyāmasya ca balena mūla sahitāḥ same api daśa vāyavaḥ hṛdaya sthāna ahata bindau tathā eva tiṣṭhanti yathā ca mṛtyu kāle dhātavaḥ vilīyante
translated: The discrimination of mind, by the power of external mudra and internal pranayama, the ten winds along with the root, even in the equal state, remain in the bindu struck in the place of the heart just as the elements dissolve at the time of death.

analyzed: etad sthitau āloka jñānam udeti
translated: In this state, the knowledge of light arises.

analyzed: ayam eva śaikṣika santati yogaḥ eva citta vivekaḥ
translated: This very yoga of the continuum of the trainee is the discrimination of mind.

original: athavā nāḍīcakrasya sarvavikalpavāyūn bhāvanābalena anāhatabindau vilīya tilakadṛdatā mahāsukhe ca cittasthitireva cittavivekaḥ /
analyzed: athavā nāḍī cakrasya sarva vikalpa vāyūn bhāvanā balena anāhatabindau vilīya tilaka dṛdatā mahāsukhe ca citta sthitiḥ eva citta vivekaḥ
translated: Or, the discrimination of mind is the very stability of mind in the great bliss of the dot struck in the bindu by the power of meditation, having dissolved all the winds of conceptualization of the cakra of channels.

analyzed: citta viveka sādhanā citta vivekasya vāstavikā avasthā ca etat bheda dvayam eva asya
translated: The means of accomplishing the discrimination of mind and the actual state of the discrimination of mind are these two divisions of it.

original: sādhanā sāmānyāvasthāyām ālokādijñānatrayasyodayaḥ samāpattyavasthāyā suṣuptyavasthāyāmacetanāvasthāyā ca jāyate /
analyzed: sādhanā sāmānya avasthāyām āloka ādi jñāna trayasya udayaḥ samāpatti avasthāyā suṣupti avasthāyām acetana avasthāyā ca jāyate
translated: The arising of the triad of knowledges such as light occurs in the state of attainment, in the state of deep sleep, and in the state of unconsciousness during the ordinary state.

analyzed: mārga ācaraṇe vajra jāpe tṛtīya prajñā jñāna abhiṣeke sākṣātkriyate
translated: This is directly realized in the practice of the path, in the vajra recitation, and in the consecration of the third wisdom knowledge.

analyzed: citta viveka siddhiḥ prayoga mārgasya dharma agra bhūmi prāptiḥ ca aikakālikī
translated: The accomplishment of mental isolation and the attainment of the supreme stage of Dharma occur simultaneously.

analyzed: kaiścid vidvadbhiḥ citta viveka sādhanāyāḥ mudrā sevanam anivārya tvena pratipāditam
translated: Some wise ones have taught that the practice of mudras is indispensable for the accomplishment of mental isolation.

original: taiḥ pañcakramasya vacanamidamuddhriyate sarvāsāmeva māyānā strīmāyaiva viśiṣyate /
analyzed: taiḥ pañcakramasya vacanam idam uddhriyate sarvāsām eva māyānā strī māyā eva viśiṣyate
translated: They quote this verse from the Five Stages: Among all the illusions, the female illusion is supreme.

analyzed: jñāna traya prabhedaḥ yaḥ sfuṭam atra eva lakṣyate
translated: The division of the three knowledges is clearly seen here.

original: arthāt cittavivekasyābhyantarasādhanāyā vajrajāpa bāhyamudrā ca sasevya ālokādīni sākṣātkaraṇīyāni bhavanti /
analyzed: arthāt citta vivekasya abhyantara sādhanāyāḥ vajra jāpa bāhya mudrā ca sa sevya āloka ādīni sākṣāt karaṇīyāni bhavanti
translated: In other words, for the internal accomplishment of mental isolation, the vajra recitation and external mudras should be practiced, and the knowledges such as light should be actualized.

analyzed: kim āloka ādi jñānam
translated: What is the knowledge of light, etc.?

analyzed: etad parijñānam āvaśyakam
translated: The complete knowledge of this is necessary.

analyzed: na anyathā sādhanā sambhāvyate
translated: Otherwise, the accomplishment is not possible.

analyzed: sakṣepeṇa idam prastūyate
translated: This is briefly presented.

analyzed: tathā ca pañcakrame sa vitti mātraka jñānam ākāśa vat alakṣaṇam
translated: And thus in the Pañcakrama, the knowledge which is mere self-experience is like space, without characteristics.

analyzed: kintu tasya prabhedaḥ usti
translated: But it has a division.

analyzed: sadhyā rātri diva ātmanā
translated: By the nature of the rising, night, and day.

analyzed: āloka āloka ābhāsau ca tathā āloka upalabdhakam
translated: And by the light, darkness, and appearance, and also by the perception of light.

analyzed: yadi api sva sa vedya jñānam eva eka mātra
translated: Although the knowledge is only one, which is self-experience,

analyzed: yat sākṣātkṛtya tatra stheyam asmābhiḥ
translated: having realized that, we should remain there.

original: etadavagamanamekatra saralantatraivāparastu duṣkaramapi yataśca etatprabhāsvarasvasavedyajñānānavagamanādeva idamavacchinna śṛkhalābaddha bhavacakra pracalati /
analyzed: etat avagamanam ekatra saralan tatra eva aparaḥ tu duṣkaram api yatas ca etat prabhāsvara sva sa vedya jñāna an avagamanāt eva idam avacchinna śṛkhalā baddha bhava cakra pracalati
translated: This understanding is simple in one place, but in the same place, the other is difficult to understand. And because of the non-understanding of this luminous self-experience knowledge, this wheel of existence bound by the chain of limited perception moves.

analyzed: prāṇī duḥkhī aśāntaḥ ca vartate
translated: The living being is miserable and unhappy.

original: atraitat sākṣātkārāya sādhanāvasthāyā prakaṭiṣyamāṇalakṣaṇānyādhārīkṛtya bhedāḥ akāriṣata /
analyzed: atra etat sākṣātkārāya sādhana avasthāyāḥ prakaṭiṣyamāṇa lakṣaṇāni ādhārīkṛtya bhedāḥ akāriṣata
translated: Here, for the realization of this, having taken as the basis the characteristics that will be revealed in the stage of the means of accomplishment, the divisions have been made.

original: pariśodhyena sāka sayojya tadvyākhyānena ca viṣayo'ya suspaṣṭībhavati /
analyzed: pariśodhyena sāka sayojya tad vyākhyānena ca suspaṣṭībhavati
translated: The subject becomes very clear by combining it with the object to be examined and by the explanation of that.

original: yathā utpādasavittiḥ utpattikramaścāste tathaiva mṛtyuḥ paramārthaśca niṣpannakrame manyate /
analyzed: yathā utpāda sa vittiḥ utpatti kramaḥ ca āste tathā eva mṛtyuḥ paramārthaḥ ca niṣpanna krame manyate
translated: Just as there is the experience of origination and the process of origination, in the same way, death and the ultimate truth are considered in the accomplished process.

original: yathoktamupari yat sāmānyāvasthāyā ālokādijñānatraya mṛtyukāle svayameva prakaṭayanti /
analyzed: yathā uktam upari yat sāmānya avasthāyāḥ āloka ādi jñāna traya mṛtyu kāle svayam eva prakaṭayanti
translated: As stated above, at the time of death, the three knowledges of light etc. in the state of generality manifest by themselves.

original: tatkatha / sāmānyataḥ ādau prāṇyutpattiḥ pañcabhūtāśrayeṇa jāyate ante caitbhūtānā visarjanena naśyatyapi /
analyzed: tat katha sāmānyatas ādau prāṇi utpattiḥ pañcabhūta āśrayeṇa jāyate ante visarjanena naśyati api
translated: How is that? In the beginning, the birth of a living being occurs through the five elements, and in the end, it perishes through the dissolution of those elements.

original: mṛtyukāle samuditalakṣaṇānā viṣaye sādhakairittha pratyapādikṣityādidhātuṣu vilīneṣu satsu śarīrābhā samāpti yāti /
analyzed: mṛtyu kāle viṣaye sādhakaiḥ ittha viṣaye sādhakaiḥ ittha pratyapādi kṣiti ādi dhātuṣu vilīneṣu satsu śarīra ābhā samāpti yāti
translated: At the time of death, when the characteristics have come together, the adepts have taught that when the elements such as earth have dissolved, the body comes to an end.

original: samānavāyoḥ kṣīṇatayā bhojanam ātmasāt na bhavati /
analyzed: samānavāyoḥ kṣīṇa tayā bhojanam ātmasāt na bhavati
translated: Due to the exhaustion of the prana vayu, food is not assimilated.

original: śarīra sarvataḥ ūṣṇa śanaiśśanaiḥ kṣīyate /🔽prāṇavāyau kṣīṇe sati cakṣurdorbalyād viṣayān draṣṭu nārhati /
analyzed: śarīra sarvatas ūṣṇa śanaiśśanais kṣīyate  prāṇa vāyau kṣīṇe sati cakṣuḥ dos balyāt viṣayān draṣṭu nā arhati
translated: The body gradually cools down from all sides and is destroyed.🔽When the prana vayu is exhausted, due to the weakness of the eyes and arms, one is unable to see objects.

analyzed: apāna vāyoḥ kṣīṇa tāyāḥ naṣṭe
translated: When the apana vayu is exhausted,

analyzed: bhavati  vyāna avāyau kṣīṇe sati aga pratyaṅgāni acetanāni jāyante
translated: urine, feces, and so on are retained.🔽When the vyana vayu is exhausted, the limbs become insensate.

original: udānavāyau naṣṭe sati śvāsalāghava praśvāsadīrghatva ca bhavati /
analyzed: udāna vāyau naṣṭe sati śvāsa lāghava praśvāsa dīrgha tva ca bhavati
translated: When the udana vayu is destroyed, there is shortness of breath and a long exhalation.

analyzed: tat anu kramaśas nāḍīcakra naṅkṣyati
translated: After that, the nadicakra gradually diminishes.

original: kṣiterjaladhātau vilīnatvāt śarīra pūrvāpekṣayā jīrṇatvamupayāti kaṇṭhaḥ śiraḥ pādau ca śarīramutthāpayitumasamarthā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: kṣiteḥ jala dhātau vilīna tvāt śarīra pūrva apekṣayā jīrṇa tvam upayāti kaṇṭhaḥ śiraḥ pādau ca śarīram utthāpayitum asamarthāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Due to the dissolution of the water element in the earth, the body will become old compared to before. The throat, head, and feet will become unable to support the body.

analyzed: hastena vastu grahaṇa asāmarthya bhaviṣyati
translated: One will be unable to grasp objects with the hand.

analyzed: mṛtyu śayyā sthaḥ janaḥ vihārāya upari utthāpayitu vakṣyati
translated: One lying on the deathbed will say, I will rise up for recreation.

analyzed: citta marīcaka ābhāsaḥ
translated: The mind will be like a mirage.

analyzed: bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be like that.

analyzed: etat agre hṛdaya nāḍī cakra kṣeṣyati
translated: This will first happen in the heart's channel wheel.

analyzed: jaladhātoḥ agnidhātau layaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The water element will dissolve into the fire element.

analyzed: mukha jihvā ādika praśuṣya kṛṣṇa tvam upayāsyati
translated: The mouth, tongue, and so on will become dry and turn black.

analyzed: saḥ duṣṭum asamarthaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: One will be unable to smell the tip of one's own nose.

original: tadānīmābhyantaracitte dhūmābhāsaḥ tadanu ca kaṇṭhanāḍīcakravināśaḥ agnighātorvāyudhātau layaśca sampatsyate /
analyzed: tadānīm ābhyantara citte dhūma ābhāsaḥ tadanu ca kaṇṭha nāḍī cakra vināśaḥ agni ghāta urvāyu dhātau layaḥ ca sampatsyate
translated: At that time, there will be an appearance of smoke in the inner mind, and then the destruction of the throat's channel wheel, the fire element's dissolution into the wind element, and the wind element's dissolution into space will occur.

analyzed: mukha nāsikābhyā śītalaḥ vāyuḥ caliṣyati
translated: A cool wind will blow from the mouth and nose.

original: anta ūṣmā śarīrād bahirnissariṣyati /🔽etadavasthāyāmantaḥ khadyotasamaḥ ābhāsaḥ /
analyzed: antaḥ ūṣmā śarīrāt bahis nissariṣyati  etad avasthāyām antar khadyota samaḥ ābhāsaḥ
translated: The inner heat will escape from the body.

analyzed: bahis vastu parijñāne ca asāmarthya syāt
translated: In this state, there will be an appearance like a firefly inside and an inability to cognize external objects.

analyzed: tatas ca naṅkṣyati
translated: Then the cakra of the secret channels will perish.

analyzed: vāyuḥ ca vijñāne vileṣyati
translated: And the vāyu will dissolve into consciousness.

original: tadānī bāhyalakṣaṇa dīrghaśvāsapraśvāsarūpeṇa prakaṭiṣyati bahiśca praśvāso bhūyān śvāsaśca laghurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tadānīm dīrgha śvāsa praśvāsa rūpeṇa prakaṭiṣyati bahis ca praśvāsaḥ bhūyān śvāsaḥ ca laghuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: At that time, the external sign will manifest in the form of long inhalation and exhalation, and the exhalation will be greater outside and the inhalation will be shorter.

analyzed: khara khara dhvaniḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be a harsh sound.

analyzed: ābhyantare pradīpa prajvalanam iva ābhāsaḥ jñāsyate
translated: The light will be known as if a lamp is burning inside.

original: ittha pañcapradhānavāyubhiḥ saha aṅgavāyurapi vijñāne vileṣyati /
analyzed: itthā pañca pradhāna vāyubhiḥ saha aṅga vāyuḥ api vijñāne vileṣyati
translated: Thus, the subsidiary vāyu will also dissolve into consciousness along with the five principal vāyus.

analyzed: indriyāṇi ca kārya kartum a sāmarthyam upayāsyanti
translated: And the senses will become incapable of performing their functions.

analyzed: laya vidhiḥ ayam
translated: This is the dissolution process of the external gross elements.

analyzed: tatas ca ābhyantara sūkṣmayoḥ layaḥ
translated: Then there is dissolution of the internal subtle ones.

analyzed: ayam eva tri jñānasya laya kālaḥ
translated: This is the time of dissolution of the three knowledges.

original: etatkramaḥ svarūpañcettham ālokajñānam sarvavāyavo hṛdayakamalasthacitte līyante /
analyzed: etat kramaḥ svarūpam ca ittham āloka jñānam sarva vāyavaḥ hṛdaya kamala stha citte līyante
translated: This is the sequence and nature: The knowledge of light, all the vāyus dissolve into the mind located in the heart lotus.

original: tadanu uṣṇīṣastha pitṛlabdha śvetaśukra madhyamānāḍīmārgato hṛdayakamala praviśati /
analyzed: tadanu uṣṇīṣa stha pitṛ labdha śveta śukra madhyamā nāḍī mārgataḥ hṛdaya kamala praviśati
translated: After that, the white semen obtained from the father located in the uṣṇīṣa enters the heart lotus through the path of the madhyamā channel in the middle.

original: tadānī citte śaradṛtucandraprakāśena prakīrṇākāśavad ābhāsate dveṣasambaddhāstrastriśad vikalpāḥ nirūdhyante /
analyzed: tadānī citte śarad ṛtu candra prakāśena prakīrṇa ākāśa vat ābhāsate dveṣa sambaddha astraḥ triśat vikalpāḥ nirūdhyante
translated: At that time, the mind appears like the sky filled with the light of the autumn moon, and the forty-three conceptual thoughts connected with hatred cease.

analyzed: tad kāle na anyaḥ kaścana ābhāsaḥ bhavati
translated: At that time, there is no appearance other than the appearance of light.

analyzed: āloka ābhāsaḥ yam eva yat ca āloka jñāna śūnyatayoḥ a dvasthitiḥ
translated: This very appearance of light is the non-dual state of the emptiness of the knowledge of light.

original: ālokābhāsajñānam māturlabdha rakta madhyamānāḍyā mādhyamenādhobhāgataḥ ūrdhva prati savardhya hṛdayakamala prāpnoti /
analyzed: āloka ābhāsa jñānam mātuḥ labdha madhyamā nāḍyā mādhyamena adhobhāgataḥ ūrdhva prati hṛdaya kamala prāpnoti
translated: The knowledge of the appearance of light arises from the mother, obtained in the middle channel, rising upwards from the lower part to the heart lotus.

original: tadā citte sūryaprakāśena vyāptākāśasama rakta ālokābhāsajñāna samudeti /
analyzed: tadā citte sūrya prakāśena vyāpta ākāśa sama raktaḥ āloka ābhāsa jñāna samudeti
translated: At that time, the knowledge of the appearance of light, filled with the light of the sun in the mind, arises like the sky filled with the light of the autumn moon.

analyzed: yat ca ati śūnyatayā saha sthāpayati
translated: And that which establishes the non-dual state with the supreme emptiness.

original: tadānī citte raktālokābhāsātirikta kimapi na bhavati /
analyzed: tadānī citte kim api na bhavati
translated: At that time, there is nothing in the mind except the appearance of the red light.

analyzed: idam eva āloka ābhāsa jñānam
translated: This is the knowledge of the appearance of light.

original: idānī rāgasambaddhāḥ sarve'pi catvāriśad vikalpāḥ naśyanti /
analyzed: idānī rāga sambaddhāḥ sarve api catvāriśat vikalpāḥ naśyanti
translated: Now, all forty conceptual thoughts connected with passion also perish.

analyzed: āloka upalabdha jñānam śukra śoṇitayoḥ anāhata bindau prabhāsvare
translated: The knowledge of the appearance of light is the luminous bindu in the semen and blood.

original: vilaye sati prabhāsvarasya prabhāsamakṣa kṣaṇameka sādhakasya citte viṣayasyāspaṣṭaḥ ābhāso jāyate /
analyzed: vilaye sati prabhāsvarasya prabhā samakṣa kṣaṇameka sādhakasya citte viṣayasya aspaṣṭaḥ ābhāsaḥ jāyate
translated: When dissolution occurs, the clear light appears indistinctly to the mind of the practitioner for a moment.

analyzed: asyām avasthāyām cittamātrasya eva aspaṣṭaḥ ābhāsaḥ bhavati
translated: In this state, the indistinct appearance belongs only to the mind.

analyzed: mahāśūnyatayā ca sāka tad advaya bhāva prāpnoti
translated: And by the great emptiness, it attains the state of non-duality with that.

analyzed: iyam eva sthitiḥ āloka upalabdha jñānasya
translated: This very state is the attainment of the knowledge of the appearance of light.

analyzed: moha sambaddhāḥ vikalpāḥ asyām avasthāyāḥ nirūdhyante
translated: The conceptual thoughts bound to delusion cease in this state.

original: prabhāsvaraḥ upari varṇite trijñānasvarūpe tatkrame ca jñānatrayasya sidhau satyā prabhāsvarapadopalabdhimārgaḥ udghaṭate /
analyzed: prabhāsvaraḥ upari varṇite tri jñāna svarūpe tad krame ca jñāna trayasya sidhau satyā prabhāsvara pada upalabdhi mārgaḥ udghaṭate
translated: The clear light is the path of attainment that is attained after the three knowledges described above and their sequence have been accomplished.

analyzed: āloka upalabdha padasya upalabdha arthaḥ eva prabhāsvara naikaṭya āptiḥ
translated: The meaning of the attainment of the state of the appearance of light is the attainment of proximity to the clear light.

analyzed: upalabdha kṣaṇa anantara dvitīya kṣaṇe prabhāsvara jñāna viṣaya viṣayi sarva dharma śūnyatayā advaya jāyate
translated: In the second moment after the moment of attainment, the non-dual clear light knowledge arises due to the emptiness of all phenomena, the object and subject.

original: aya mātṛprabhāsvaraḥ tena ca kṛtaḥ prabhāsvarapadasākṣātkāraḥ mātṛvad vartate /
analyzed: mātṛ prabhāsvaraḥ tena ca kṛtaḥ prabhāsvara pada sākṣātkāraḥ mātṛ vat vartate
translated: This is the mother clear light, and the clear light attainment made by that occurs like a mother.

original: sādhakaḥ svajīvanakāle madhyamānāḍīsahāyatayā vāyoḥ praveśasthityutthāpanādika kṛtvā trijñāna prakāśya taddvārā śūnyatā sākṣātkurūte /
analyzed: sādhakaḥ sva jīvana kāle madhyamā nāḍī sahāya tayā vāyoḥ praveśa sthiti utthāpana ādika kṛtvā tri jñāna prakāśya tad dvārā śūnyatā sākṣātkurūte
translated: The adept, during his lifetime, having caused the entry, abiding, and arising of the breath through the assistance of the madhyamā channel, manifests the three knowledges and thereby realizes emptiness.

original: sa eva mṛtyukāle udeṣyamāṇalakṣaṇāni krameṇa paricinvan dharmakāyasthaḥ bhavati /🔽atra śūnyatāsvarūpacittādhāro vāyureva /
analyzed: saḥ eva mṛtyu kāle udeṣyamāṇa lakṣaṇāni krameṇa paricinvan dharmakāyasthaḥ bhavati  atra śūnyatā svarūpa citta ādhāraḥ vāyuḥ eva
translated: He alone, at the time of death, gradually discerning the arising characteristics, abides in the dharmakāya.🔽Here, the support of the mind of the nature of emptiness is the breath itself.

analyzed: ālokasya svādhāraḥ vāyu sahita śūnyatva vartate
translated: The support of the light is the emptiness accompanied by the breath.

analyzed: iyam eva śūnyatā
translated: This is emptiness itself.

analyzed: idam eva advaya āloka jñānam
translated: This is the non-dual knowledge of light.

analyzed: tathā eva āloka ābhāsa advayam  prabhāsvara sarva śūnya advaya prabhāsvara jñāna vidyate
translated: In the same way, there is non-duality of the appearance of light.🔽The luminous, all-empty, non-dual, luminous knowledge exists.

original: prabhāsvaro'ya viṣayaviṣayibhedena dvividhaḥ sarvaśūnyatā hi viṣayaprabhāsvaraḥ sarvaśūnyatāyāḥ svaviṣayavidhāyaka jñāna viṣayiprabhāsvaro vidyate /
analyzed: viṣaya viṣayi bhedena dvividhaḥ sarva śūnyatā hi viṣaya prabhāsvaraḥ sarva śūnyatāyāḥ sva viṣaya vidhāyaka jñāna viṣayi prabhāsvaraḥ vidyate
translated: This luminosity is of two kinds, divided into object and subject. The luminosity of the object is all emptiness, and the luminosity of the subject is the knowledge that indicates the object of all emptiness.
The external limb of the practice of mental isolation is mudrā.

original: mudrāśabdābhiprāyastu hevajratantre vajreṇa mudrayate'nena mudrā tenābhidhīyate //
analyzed: mudrā śabda abhiprāyaḥ tu hevajratantre vajreṇa mudrayatena ina mudrā tena abhidhīyate
translated: The meaning of the word mudrā is stated in the Hevajra Tantra: It is mudrayed by vajra, thus it is called mudrā.

analyzed: mudrā ca dvividhā karmamudrā
translated: And the mudra is of two kinds: karmamudra.
And jnanamudra.

analyzed: yat karmaṇā utpanna keśa stana ādi yukta tā sā karma mudrā
translated: The possession of hair, breasts, etc. arising from karma is the karmamudra.

original: jñānamudrā ca yad jñānamātreṇa nirmitā syāt /
analyzed: jñāna mudrā ca yat jñāna mātreṇa nirmitā syāt
translated: And the jnanamudra is that which would be created merely by knowledge.
The internal means is pranayama itself.

original: tadupari piṇḍakramasya anubhedana kramasya ca bhāvanā kriyate /
analyzed: tad upari piṇḍa kramasya anubhedana kramasya ca bhāvanā kriyate
translated: On top of that, the meditation of the Pindakrama and the Anubhedakrama is done.

original: pañcakrame etat spaṣṭīkriyate prāptopadeśakaḥ śiṣyo dvidhā yogam athābhyaset /
analyzed: pañca krame etat spaṣṭīkriyate prāpta upadeśakaḥ śiṣyaḥ dvidhā yogam atha abhyaset
translated: This is clarified in the Pancakrama: The disciple who has received the teaching should practice yoga in two ways.

analyzed: piṇḍa grāha krameṇa eva tathā ca eva anubhedataḥ
translated: By the method of grasping the aggregate, and also by the method of non-penetration.

analyzed: śirasaḥ pādataḥ vā api yāvat hṛdayam āgataḥ
translated: Having come from the head or the feet up to the heart,

original: bhūtakoṭi viśed yogī piṇḍagrāha iti smṛtaḥ //
analyzed: viśet yogī piṇḍagrāhaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: the yogi should enter the peak of existence, this is known as grasping the aggregate.

original: sthāvara jaṅgama caiva pūrva kṛtvā prabhāsvaram /
analyzed: sthāvara jaṅgama ca eva pūrva kṛtvā prabhāsvaram
translated: Having first made the immovable and the moving beings luminous,

analyzed: paścāt kuryāt tathā ātmānam anubheda kramaḥ hi ayam
translated: then one should make oneself luminous, this is the method of non-penetration.

analyzed: śvāsa vātaḥ yathā ādarśe laya gacchati sarvatas
translated: Just as the breath goes out in all directions in a mirror,

analyzed: bhūtakoṭi tathā yogī praviśet ca muhur muhur
translated: the yogi should repeatedly enter the peak of existence.

analyzed: sādhakaḥ svayam iṣṭadeva bhāvayati
translated: The practitioner of the meditation on the aggregate of the pindakrama visualizes himself as the desired deity.

analyzed: tatra iṣṭadevam hṛdaya prabhāsvara paryanta vilīyamāna svarūpe dhyāyati
translated: There, he meditates on the form of the chosen deity dissolving into the luminous heart, up to the end of the luminous heart.

original: anubhedakrame devabhāvanecchāyā satyā pūrva bāhyamaṇdalamātmaśarīre vyastadeveṣu tatrāpyekaika hṛdayasthitacittaprabhāsvare sthāvara jagame jagama ca kramaśaḥ svātmani /
analyzed: anubheda krame deva bhāvanā icchāyā satyā vyasta deveṣu tatra api ekaika hṛdaya sthita citta prabhāsvare sthāvara ca kramaśas sva ātmani
translated: In the practice of non-differentiation, when there is a desire to meditate on the divine nature, the external maṇḍala is first dissolved into one's own body, and into the individual deities there. Even there, each one dissolves into the luminous heart, and into the moving and unmoving world, gradually into one's own self.

original: ātmāna ca svaprabhāsvare tathaiva līnayate yathā ca uṣṇe ṛjīṣe jalapātanena jala vilīna sat ekabindau militvā śuṣyati /
analyzed: ātmāna ca sva prabhāsvare tathā eva līnayate yathā ca uṣṇe ṛjīṣe jala pātanena jala vilīna sat eka bindau militvā śuṣyati
translated: And the self also dissolves into the luminous heart in the same way, just as when hot chaff is sprinkled with water, the water dissolves, merges into a single drop, and dries up.

analyzed: prabhāsvare vilaya prakriyā iyam anubheda kramaḥ vartate
translated: This process of dissolution into the luminous is the practice of non-differentiation.

analyzed: caturtha kramasya sādhanā vidhiḥ tathā api paddhatiḥ iyam atrā api prayujyate
translated: Although this is the method of practice for the fourth stage, this procedure is also employed here.

original: cittavivekasya sādhanayā'nayā śūnyatāyāḥ sāmānyārthabodha eva jāyate /
analyzed: citta vivekasya sādhanayā anayā śūnyatāyāḥ sāmānya artha bodhaḥ eva jāyate
translated: By this means of practice of the discrimination of mind, only the general understanding of emptiness arises.

analyzed: prayoga mārgasya dharma agra mārgasya ca ayam eva abhisamayaḥ
translated: This is the direct realization of the path of application and the path of the highest dharma.

analyzed: atas citta vivekasya prabhāsvara tā upamā prabhāsvara tvena api ucyate
translated: Therefore, the luminosity of the discrimination of mind is also called the luminosity of simile-luminosity.

original: apagaterūdgatiparivartanam cittavivekaparyantam niṣpannopamāprabhāsvarasya karmavāyunā spandanena sādhakaḥ pratilomālokopalabdhau tadutthāpayati
analyzed: apagateḥ ūdgati parivartanam citta viveka paryantam niṣpanna upamā prabhāsvarasya karma vāyunā spandanena sādhakaḥ pratiloma āloka upalabdhau tat utthāpayati
translated: The turning of the mind away from the arising and falling away, up to the isolation of the mind, the practitioner, by the wind of karma of the perfected luminous mind, causes the arising of the illusory body in the perception of the reversed light through the shaking.

analyzed: citta vivekāt māyā kāye parivartana sakramaṇayoḥ ucyate
translated: This time is said to be the turning and transference of the illusory body from the isolation of the mind.

original: hṛdayakamalasthamadhyanāḍīsahitasya sampūrṇanāḍīcakrasya granthiṣūdghaṭitāsu satīṣu māyākāye utthāpanāvasthā yāvat sampūrṇaprakriyā cittaviveke māyākāye ca utthāpitā jāyate tadabhyāsakramo hi māyākāya ucyate /
analyzed: hṛdaya kamala stha madhyanāḍī sahitasya sampūrṇa nāḍī cakrasya granthiṣu udghaṭitāsu satīṣu māyā kāye utthāpana avasthā yāvat sampūrṇa prakriyā citta viveke māyā kāye ca utthāpitā jāyate tad abhyāsa kramaḥ hi māyā kāyaḥ ucyate
translated: When the knots of the complete cakra of channels along with the central channel in the heart lotus are opened, the stage of arising of the illusory body up to the complete process arises from the isolation of the mind and the illusory body. The sequence of practice of that is said to be the illusory body.
The illusory body manifests as the luminous mind in the stage of the isolation of the mind.

analyzed: etad sahakāri pratyayaḥ sūkṣma prāṇa vāyuḥ asti
translated: The cooperating condition for this is the subtle life-sustaining wind.

analyzed: upādānakāraka cittam asti
translated: And there is the appropriating cause, the mind.

analyzed: yat ca lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana vibhūṣite deva kāye bhavati
translated: And that which arises as the divine body adorned with the major and minor marks,

analyzed: ayam eva māyā kāyaḥ ucyate
translated: this very one is called the illusory body.

analyzed: ayam eva āsrava jñāna kāyaḥ
translated: This very one is the body of uncontaminated wisdom.

analyzed: samāhita māyākāya pṛṣṭhalabdha māyākāya svapna māyākāya antarābhava māyā kāya ākhyāḥ catvāraḥ bhedāḥ etasya
translated: The four divisions of this are: the concentrated magical body, the attained magical body, the dream magical body, and the intermediate state magical body.

original: cittavivekānantarameva upalabdhamāyākāyaḥ abhyāsakramasya māyākāyaḥ paryantamāyākāyaśceti nāmnā bhedatrayamapi vidhātu śakyate /
analyzed: citta viveka anantaram eva upalabdha māyā kāyaḥ abhyāsa kramasya māyā kāyaḥ paryanta māyā kāyaḥ ca iti nāmnā bheda trayam api vidhātu śakyate
translated: Immediately after the separation of mind, the attained magical body, the magical body of the sequence of practice, and the ultimate magical body can also be named as the three divisions.

original: vyutpattiḥ māyākāyādidvādaśopamālakṣitaḥ āsravajñānakāya eva māyākāya ucyate /
analyzed: vyutpattiḥ māyā kāya ādi dvādaśa upamā lakṣitaḥ āsrava jñāna kāyaḥ eva māyā kāyaḥ ucyate
translated: The derivation: The body of the knowledge of the outflows, characterized by the twelve similes such as the magical body, is called the magical body.

analyzed: dvādaśa upamāḥ imāḥ prāṇa cittamātra utpanna tvāt aya māyā upamaḥ
translated: These are the twelve similes: It is like a magical creation because it arises from mere life and mind.

analyzed: sarva vyāptaḥ śaśi pratibimba sadṛśaḥ
translated: This one is all-pervading, like the reflection of the moon.

analyzed: aya māsa asthi rūdhira ādi rahita pratibhāsa sadṛśaḥ
translated: This one is like the appearance devoid of monthly instability, blood, and so on.

analyzed: pratikṣaṇa sa spanditaḥ marīci sadṛśaḥ
translated: It is momentary and quivering, like a mirage.

analyzed: prāṇa vāyu sampannaḥ sthūla kāya atiriktaḥ sūkṣma svapna kāya sadṛśaḥ
translated: Endowed with the vital wind, it is separate from the gross body and similar to the subtle dream body.

analyzed: vipāka kāya sambaddhaḥ san api anyasmin pratibhāsamānaḥ pratiśruta kāya sadṛśaḥ
translated: Although connected to the body of ripening, it appears elsewhere, like an echo.

analyzed: gandharvanagara sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is like a gandharva city.

analyzed: ekasmin sati aneka iṣu ābhāsita indrajāla sadṛśaḥ
translated: When one exists, many are illuminated, like a magic trick.

analyzed: kāyasya asya pañca varṇāḥ amiśritāḥ indradhanuṣa sadṛśāḥ ca
translated: This body has five unmixed colors, like a rainbow.

original: vipākakāyo meghasadṛśaḥ māyākāyaśca meghamadhyād āvirbhūtā vidyudiva vartate /
analyzed: vipāka kāyaḥ megha sadṛśaḥ māyā kāyaḥ ca megha madhyāt āvirbhūtā vidyut iva vartate
translated: The body of ripening is like a cloud, and the illusory body appears from within the cloud, like lightning.

analyzed: jalāt
translated: This is the nature of emptiness, like a bubble rising from water and dissolving.

analyzed: aṅga pratyaṅgayoḥ paripūrṇa tā rūpa ādarśe pratibimbita vajradhara rūpa upamaḥ
translated: The major and minor parts are like the form of Vajradhara reflected in a full mirror.

analyzed: etāsu upamāsu svapna upamā anya apekṣayā uttamā abhimanyate
translated: Among these similes, the simile of a dream is considered superior to the others.

original: yato hi svajīvanasya pañcaviśatipratiśata samaya janaḥ rātrau svapnāvalokane eva yāpayati /
analyzed: yatas hi sva jīvanasya pañcaviśatipratiśata samaya janaḥ rātrau svapnāvalokane eva yāpayati
translated: Because in one's own life, twenty-five percent of people spend the night only looking at dreams.

analyzed: yathā ca svapnāya nidrā a nivāryā
translated: And just as sleep cannot be avoided in dreaming,

analyzed: tathā eva atra māyā kāyasya utthāpanāya vijñāna pūrva gamanam āvaśyakam
translated: in the same way, the prior movement of consciousness is necessary for the arising of the illusory body here.

analyzed: nidrāyāḥ svapna āgamana māyā kāya samam
translated: Sleep is like the coming of dreams, like the illusory body.

original: māyākāyasya sādhakaḥ sthūlakāyena sūkṣmakāya nirmāya vicarati /
analyzed: māyā kāyasya sādhakaḥ sthūla kāyena sūkṣma kāya nirmāya vicarati
translated: The practitioner of the illusory body, having created a subtle body with a gross body, moves about.

original: iya tādṛśyeva kriyā yathā ca svapnāvasthāyā sthūlakāyāt sūkṣmakāyasya pṛthak sthitiḥ /
analyzed: iyam tādṛśī eva kriyā yathā ca svapna avasthāyāḥ sthūla kāyāt sūkṣma kāyasya pṛthak sthitiḥ
translated: This is the same kind of action as in the state of sleep, where the subtle body is separate from the gross body.

analyzed: svapna anusāra kāyasya rūpa traya vilokyate
translated: In the dream body, the three forms are seen.

original: kuśalākuśalavipākāt samutpannasukhaduḥkhavāhako vipākakāyaḥ / vibhinnasaskāravāsanābhyaḥ prabhāvitaḥ pratibhāsitaḥ svapnakāyaḥ / aśuddhāvasthāyā manomayakāyaḥ śuddhāvasthāyā ca jñānakāyaḥ /
analyzed: kuśala akuśala vipākāt samutpanna sukha duḥkha vāhakaḥ vipāka kāyaḥ vibhinna saskāra vāsanābhyaḥ prabhāvitaḥ pratibhāsitaḥ svapna kāyaḥ aśuddha avasthāyāḥ manaḥ maya kāyaḥ śuddha avasthāyāḥ ca jñāna kāyaḥ
translated: The body of fruition, which carries the pleasant and unpleasant results arising from wholesome and unwholesome actions, is influenced and manifested by the various habitual tendencies. The dream body is the mind-made body in the impure state and the body of wisdom in the pure state.

analyzed: yaḥ ca prabhāsvara abhinnaḥ tiṣṭhati ayam eva nija kāyaḥ
translated: And the one who abides inseparable from the luminous [mind] is the very own body.

analyzed: etad traye māyā kāya sādhana āśrayaḥ sva santati svabhāva sthaḥ sūkṣma nija kāyaḥ eva asti
translated: In these three, the subtle own body, which is the basis for accomplishing the illusory body and abides as the nature of one's own continuum, exists.

original: svapnakāyo'pi māyākāyasādhanādhāro na bhavitumarhati yato hyaya kālikaḥ /
analyzed: svapna kāyaḥ api māyā kāya sādhana ādhāraḥ na bhavitum arhati yatas kālikaḥ
translated: The dream body is also not suitable to be the basis for accomplishing the illusory body, because it is momentary.

analyzed: atas nija kāya ūrthāt sūkṣma prāṇa cittam eva māyā kāya sādhana āśrayam
translated: Therefore, the subtle life-force and mind, which is the own body, is the basis for accomplishing the illusory body.

analyzed: asya eva gṛha sadṛśaḥ sthūla kāyaḥ  mūla pañca vāyuṣu prāṇa vāyuḥ asti
translated: This very one's gross body is like a house.🔽Among the five root winds, there is the life-force wind.

analyzed: prāṇa vāyuḥ api sthūla sūkṣma bhedābhyā dvividhaḥ
translated: The life-force wind is also of two kinds, divided into gross and subtle.

original: ekastu yasya prāṇeṣu samāpteṣu mṛtyurbhavati sa bhavati dvitīyaśca yaḥ indriyānāśritaḥ manovijñānāśrito'sti / sa prāṇāḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ tu yasya prāṇeṣu samāpteṣu mṛtyuḥ bhavati sa bhavati dvitīyaḥ ca yaḥ indriya anāśritaḥ manaḥ vijñāna āśritaḥ asti sa prāṇāḥ
translated: One who has his life-force exhausted, death occurs for him. That is the first. And the second is he who is not dependent on the senses, but dependent on the mind-consciousness. That is the life-force.

analyzed: mṛtyoḥ anantaram anena eva antara abhāve ca utpādaḥ
translated: Immediately after death, he is born in the intermediate state by this very [body].

original: mārge sādhanābalenaiva ayameva māyākāya utthāpito bhavati /
analyzed: mārge sādhanā balena eva ayam eva māyā kāyaḥ utthāpitaḥ bhavati
translated: And when this [body] is raised by the power of the path, it is raised by the power of the means alone.

original: yadā ca karmakleśavaśo'ya jayate tadā bhavacakre vibhinnarūpeṣu āvirbhūya prāṇī sasāracakre bhramati /
analyzed: yadā ca jayate tadā bhava cakre vibhinna rūpeṣu āvirbhūya prāṇī sa sāra cakre bhramati
translated: And when he is born by the power of karma and afflictions, then appearing in various forms in the wheel of existence, the living being wanders in the wheel of transmigration.

analyzed: etad mūlam api etat eva prāṇi cittam
translated: And this root also is this very mind of the living being.

original: pañcakrame'pyabhihitam asvatantra jagatsarva svatantra naiva jāyate /
analyzed: pañca krame pi abhihitam asvatantra jagat sarva svatantra na eva jāyate
translated: It is said in the Pañcakrama: The entire world is not independent, it is not born as independent.

analyzed: hetuḥ prabhāsvara tasya sarva śūnya prabhāsvaram
translated: The cause of that is luminous, and everything is luminous.

analyzed: yena cittena bālāḥ ca
translated: And by which mind the foolish

analyzed: sasāre bandhana gatāḥ
translated: are bound in transmigration,

analyzed: yoginaḥ tena cittena gati gatāḥ
translated: by that same mind the yogis have gone to the state of the Sugatas.

analyzed: nikhila jagat sūkṣma prāṇa cittāt eva utpadyate
translated: Everything arises from the subtle mind of the living beings of the entire world.

analyzed: na tu sva svadharma astitva paramparayā
translated: But not by the succession of the existence of one's own inherent nature.

original: sarvahetuḥ prabhāsvaraḥ yaśca mahāśūnyasvarūpaḥ cittasya pañcaraśmivāyoścādvayarūpam /
analyzed: sarva hetuḥ prabhāsvaraḥ yaḥ ca mahā śūnya svarūpaḥ cittasya pañca raśmi vāyoḥ ca advaya rūpam
translated: The universal cause is the luminous one, and he who is of the nature of great emptiness is the non-dual form of the mind and the five-rayed wind.

analyzed: tasya ca ārdra tā agniḥ tasya ca uṣṇa tā
translated: Just as moisture is of water and heat is of fire.

original: tāntrikadarśanasya marmatva cittasya sūkṣmavāyoścābhinnatāyāḥ prakāśito māyākāya etadeva tantrasya rahasyam /
analyzed: tāntrika darśanasya cittasya sūkṣma vāyoḥ ca abhinna tāyāḥ prakāśitaḥ māyā kāyaḥ etat eva tantrasya rahasyam
translated: The secret of this Tantra is the revelation of the non-difference of the subtle wind and the mind, which is the essence of the Tantric view.

analyzed: etat anubhāvaḥ gurum antareṇa na kartu pāryyate
translated: This cannot be done without a guru.

original: atreda jñeya kāyasya rūpadvaya sthūla sūkṣma ca /
analyzed: atra idam jñeya kāyasya rūpa dvaya sthūla sūkṣma ca
translated: Here, this should be known: the body has two forms, gross and subtle.

original: etatpuṣṭistu sādhanā binā sāmānyataḥ sūkṣmakāyo mṛtyukāle bhavati iti vārtayā bhavati /
analyzed: etat puṣṭiḥ tu sādhanā binā sāmānyatas sūkṣma kāyaḥ mṛtyu kāle bhavati iti vārtayā bhavati
translated: This nourishment is the means of accomplishment. Without it, the subtle body occurs at the time of death, it is said.

original: jīvanakāle māyākāya sādhayitvā sākṣātkaroti tarhi antarābhave trijñānavilayānantara sabhogakāye utthāpitaḥ san mucyate /
analyzed: jīvana kāle māyā kāya sādhayitvā sākṣātkaroti tarhi antarābhave tri jñāna vilaya anantara sa bhoga kāye utthāpitaḥ san mucyate
translated: If one accomplishes and realizes the illusory body during life, then one is liberated after arising in the body with enjoyment immediately after the dissolution of the three consciousnesses in the intermediate state.

original: yataḥ antarābhavasya prāṇikāyaḥ sūkṣmaprāṇacittakāya eva bhavati /
analyzed: yatas antarābhavasya prāṇi kāyaḥ sūkṣmaprāṇa citta kāyaḥ eva bhavati
translated: Because the body of the intermediate state is only the subtle vital wind and mind body.

original: aparataśca sādhanābalena sarvavāyuṣu anāhate satsu māyākāyasya sādhanāsiddhyai kāyadvayajñānamāvaśyakam /
analyzed: aparatas ca sādhanā balena sarva vāyuṣu anāhate satsu māyā kāyasya sādhanā siddhyai kāya dvaya jñānam āvaśyakam
translated: Moreover, by the power of practice, when all the vital airs are unobstructed, for the accomplishment of the illusory body, the knowledge of the two bodies is necessary.

original: atreda vicāraṇīya yadā sūkṣmakāye sādhakaḥ utthāpito bhavati tadā sthūlakāyāt tasya sambandhavicchedo bhavati na vā /
analyzed: atra idam vicāraṇīya yadā sūkṣmakāye sādhakaḥ utthāpitaḥ bhavati tadā sthūlakāyāt tasya sambandha vicchedaḥ bhavati na vā
translated: Here this should be considered: when the practitioner is raised in the subtle body, is there a severance of his connection with the gross body or not?

analyzed: kecana vivāsaḥ vicchedam amanyanta
translated: Some think there is severance.

analyzed: kecid ca viccheda vinā api sūkṣmakāye utthāpanam aṅgīkṛtavantaḥ
translated: Some accept the raising of the subtle body even without severance.

analyzed: bhavet
translated: Both views could be appropriate.

original: kim na sambhāvyate yāvat samādhibalena sādhakaḥ māyākāye utthāpito bhaviṣyati tāvat sthūlakāyāt pṛthak sa sthāsyati /
analyzed: kim na sambhāvyate yāvat samādhi balena sādhakaḥ māyā kāye utthāpitaḥ bhaviṣyati tāvat sthūla kāyāt pṛthak sa sthāsyati
translated: Why is it not possible? As long as the practitioner is raised in the illusory body by the power of concentration, he will remain separate from the gross body.

original: samādhibale samāpte sati sa punaḥ sthūlakāye parāvartiṣyate /
analyzed: samādhi bale samāpte sati sa punar sthūlakāye parāvartiṣyate
translated: When the power of concentration is complete, he will return to the gross body.

original: vastutaḥ sādhakaḥ yāvat paramārthaprabhāsvara prathamabhūmi ca na prāpsyati tāvat sūkṣmakāyasyecchānusāra sthūlakāyāt sampūrṇaḥ sambandhavicchedo bhavediti na pratīyate /
analyzed: vastutas sādhakaḥ yāvat paramārtha prabhāsvara prathama bhūmi ca na prāpsyati tāvat sūkṣmakāyasya icchā anusāra sthūlakāyāt sampūrṇaḥ sambandha vicchedaḥ bhavet iti na pratīyate
translated: In reality, as long as the practitioner does not attain the ultimate clear light and the first stage, it is not understood that the complete severance of the connection with the gross body will occur according to the desire of the subtle body.

original: sādhanā sāmānyato māyākāyasādhanāsādhakena caturguṇaiḥ sampannena bhāvyam /
analyzed: sādhanā sāmānyatas māyā kāya sādhanā sādhakena caturguṇaiḥ sampannena bhāvyam
translated: The practitioner should be endowed with the four qualities of the means of accomplishing the illusory body in general.

original: sa utpattikramasya sthūlasūkṣmobhayavidhyoḥ dṛdatā prāpnuyāt / tantracatuṣṭayārthajñātā bhavet / kāyavākcittavivekānā samyak sādhanā kuryāt / yuganaddhakramasya bhāvanābhilāṣī bhavet /
analyzed: sa utpatti kramasya sthūla sūkṣma ubhaya vidhyoḥ dṛdatā prāpnuyāt tantra catuṣṭaya artha jñātā bhavet samyak sādhanā kuryāt yuga naddha kramasya bhāvanā abhilāṣī bhavet
translated: He should attain firmness in the gross and subtle aspects of the sequence of arising, know the meaning of the four tantras, properly perform the practice of the separation of body, speech, and mind, and be desirous of meditating on the yoga of the unified stage.

original: māyākāyasya sādhanā atiguhyatvena rahasyapūrṇatayā ca gurūpadeśa binā na sambhāvyate /
analyzed: māyā kāyasya sādhanā ati guhya tvena rahasya pūrṇa tayā ca guru upadeśa binā na sambhāvyate
translated: The means of accomplishing the illusory body is not possible without the teacher's instruction due to its extreme secrecy and fullness of mystery.

original: etadarthamadhimuktyā saha śaiṣīrya nāsti te kāye māsāsthirūdhira na ca /
analyzed: etad artham adhimuktyā saha na asti te kāye māsa asthi rūdhira na ca
translated: For this purpose, one should request the teacher with devotion, saying, In your body, there is no flesh, bone, or blood.

analyzed: indrāyudham iva ākāśe kāya darśitavān asi
translated: You have shown a body in the sky like a rainbow.

original: tathā sarvajñayānasadoha eva pañcakromapadiṣṭapaddhatyā gurū sastutya māyākāyasya rahasya khyāpayitu saḥ abhyarthanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sarvajña yāna sa dohaḥ eva pañcakroma padiṣṭa paddhatyā gurū sastutya māyā kāyasya rahasya khyāpayitu saḥ abhyarthanīyaḥ
translated: Similarly, one should request the teacher, who is praised by all the Buddhas, to reveal the secret of the illusory body through the path taught in the five stages of the path of the vehicle of omniscience.

analyzed: māyā kāyasya kaḥ hetu pratyayaḥ
translated: What is the cause and condition of the illusory body?

original: cittamātreṇa vāyorabhāve cāpi rūpa na sidhyati /
analyzed: citta mātreṇa vāyoḥ abhāve ca api na sidhyati
translated: Without mind, and in the absence of air, form is not established.

original: vāyumātre sati citte asatyapi jñāna na sambhāvyate /
analyzed: vāyu mātre sati citte asati api na sambhāvyate
translated: When there is only air, even if there is no mind, knowledge is not possible.

original: bhautikavādivat bhūtebhya eva sarvavastūtpattirna mantu śakyate /
analyzed: bhautika vādi vat bhūtebhyaḥ eva sarva vastu utpattiḥ na mantu śakyate
translated: Like the proponents of materiality, it cannot be said that all things arise from the elements alone.

original: anubhavakṣetre cittasya rūpasvīkṛti binā neda sambhāvyate /
analyzed: anubhava kṣetre cittasya sambhāvyate
translated: And in the field of experience, it is not possible without the mind accepting form.

analyzed: jaḍa mātrāt cetanā utpattau abhimatāyāḥ na ekatva katha
translated: If the arising of consciousness from mere inert matter is accepted, how can there be oneness?

analyzed: kena prakārena
translated: In what way?

original: ityādipraśnavācakāni cihnāni samutpadyante etadvaiparītye yadi cetanāvādino bhavema tarhi samakṣa yaddṛdavastunaḥ āghātena patāmastasyāpalāpaḥ asambhavaḥ /
analyzed: ityādi praśna vācakāni cihnāni samutpadyante etad vaiparītye yadi cetanā vādinaḥ bhavema tarhi āghātena patāmaḥ tasya apalāpaḥ asambhavaḥ
translated: Such questions are indicated by these marks. If we were proponents of consciousness, then we would fall by the blow of the existent thing right in front of us, its denial being impossible.

original: eva sthitau nāmarūpasyānyonyāśritā sattā'pyabhinnasvarūpā katha manyeta /
analyzed: eva sthitau nāma rūpasya anyonya āśritā sattā api abhinna svarūpā katha manyeta
translated: In this situation, how can one consider the existence of name and form as mutually dependent and of the same nature?

analyzed: bāhi artha ghaṭa paṭa ādeḥ śuddha cetanā svarūpasya vyākhyā kathaṅkāra kriyeta
translated: How can the external objects like pot, cloth etc., which are of the nature of pure consciousness, be explained?

original: eteṣu ca parasparasambandhaḥ katha susthāpitaḥ syāt /
analyzed: eteṣu ca paraspara sambandhaḥ su sthāpitaḥ syāt
translated: And how can the mutual connection among these be well established?

original: ki sarvadharmān prabhāsvarasūkṣmaprāṇacittāśān matvā vāyucetanayoralpādhikamanupāta svīkuryāma /
analyzed: ki sarva dharmān prabhāsvara sūkṣma prāṇa citta āśān matvā vāyu cetanayoḥ alpa adhikam anupāta svīkuryāma
translated: Should we, considering all phenomena as subtle life-force and consciousness, accept a small or greater proportion between air and consciousness?

original: yathā ca bāhyārthavādivaibhāṣikaḥ sūkṣmāṇumapi caturbhūtadhātūnā saghāta manyate /
analyzed: yathā ca bāhya artha vādi vaibhāṣikaḥ sūkṣma aṇum api catur bhūta dhātūnā sa ghāta manyate
translated: And just as the Vaibhāṣika who believes in external objects considers even the subtle atom to be a combination of the four primary elements.

original: etatsthūlatayā agnijalādisvarūpa bhavati sūkṣmacetanāyāḥ ca sthūlāḥ pañcāśat caitasikāḥ dharmāmaitrīkarūṇākrodhādīni samudbhavanti /
analyzed: etat sthūla tayā agni jala ādi svarūpa bhavati sūkṣma cetanāyāḥ ca sthūlāḥ pañcāśat caitasikāḥ dharma amaitrī karūṇā krodha ādīni samudbhavanti
translated: In this way, the gross form becomes the nature of fire, water, etc., and from the subtle consciousness, the fifty gross mental factors such as friendliness, compassion, and anger arise.

original: eva ca tadanyonyāśrita bhavatītītthammanyate tadā tu varam /
analyzed: eva ca bhavati iti ittham manyate tadā tu varam
translated: And thus he thinks that they are mutually dependent. But then it is better to accept

original: parañca kevala śuddhacetanāyāḥ vistāre'bhimate sati sati rāmaśyāmādijanaviśeṣāṇā cittasya kaḥ sambandho bhavitumarhati /
analyzed: parañca kevala śuddha cetanāyāḥ vistāra abhimate sati sati rāmaśyāma ādi jana viśeṣāṇā cittasya kaḥ sambandhaḥ bhavitum arhati
translated: that the mind is only pure and subtle, and when the extension is desired, what connection can there be between the mind and the particulars of people like Rāma and Śyāma?

original: ekasmin mukte sati sarve kathanna mucyante /
analyzed: ekasmin mukte sati sarve katham na mucyante
translated: When one is liberated, why are not all liberated?

original: etat pṛthagastitvamurarīkriyeta tarhi śāstragrantheṣvāgatāni sarvavastūni prabhāsvarāṇi katha syuḥ /
analyzed: etat pṛthak astitvam urarīkriyeta tarhi śāstra grantheṣu āgatāni sarva vastūni prabhāsvarāṇi syuḥ
translated: If this separate existence is accepted, then how could all the things mentioned in the treatises of the scriptures be luminous?

original: bodhiprāptau jano buddhatva labhate tarhi sarvajñatva kasmāt tadjñāna sarvajñeyān katha vyāpnoti /
analyzed: bodhi prāptau janaḥ buddha tva labhate tarhi sarvajña tva kasmāt tad jñāna sarva jñeyān katha vyāpnoti
translated: If a person attains enlightenment, he obtains Buddhahood, then why does he not obtain omniscience? How does that knowledge pervade all knowable things?

analyzed: yāvat jñānasya vyāptiḥ tāvat eva jñāna kāya vyāptiḥ abhimatā
translated: As far as the pervasion of knowledge extends, to that extent the pervasion of the body of knowledge is accepted.

original: kathametat setsyati /🔽cet sarvajñeyeṣu prāṇiṣu ca na vyāpnoti tarhi sarvavineyajanānāmadhyāśayavāsanecchādayaḥ katha jñātu śakyāḥ yadyetat na sambhāvyate tarhi kimadhyātmaśāstrasya lakṣyam /
analyzed: katham etat setsyati  ced sarva jñeyeṣu prāṇiṣu ca na vyāpnoti tarhi sarva vineya janānām adhyāśaya vāsanā icchā ādayaḥ jñātu śakyāḥ yadi etat na sambhāvyate tarhi kim adhyātma śāstrasya lakṣyam
translated: How will this be accomplished?🔽If it does not pervade all objects of knowledge and living beings, then how can the intentions, inclinations, desires, etc. of all disciples be known? If this is not possible, then what is the purpose of the study of spiritual science?

original: etajjīvanasya śāntirnirdvandvatā caiva lakṣyantarhi kā'vaśyakatā khalvadhyātmaśāstrasya /
analyzed: etat jīvanasya śāntiḥ nirdvandva tā ca eva kā āvaśyaka tā khalu adhyātma śāstrasya
translated: If the purpose of life and non-dualism are the goals, then what is the necessity of spiritual science?

original: kvacidapi manoramaṇena manaso nirvandvatva kartu śakyam /
analyzed: kvacid api manoramaṇena manasaḥ nirvandva tva kartu śakyam
translated: Non-dualism of the mind can be achieved by pleasing the mind in some way.

analyzed: tadā tu vyasta tā eva mahādhyātma syāt
translated: But then it would be a great deviation from spirituality.

analyzed: ittham aneke praśnāḥ udbhavitum arhanti
translated: In this way, many questions may arise.

analyzed: sūkṣmaprāṇa cittam eva etat samasyānā samādhānam
translated: The solution to these problems lies in the subtle life-force and mind.
This nature cannot be understood without a guru.

analyzed: atas asmāka gurūḥ eva śaraṇam
translated: Therefore, our guru alone is the refuge.

analyzed: pañca krame pi svādhiṣṭhāna kramaḥ nāma  sa vṛteḥ satya darśanam
translated: In the Pañcakrama, there is the Svadhisthana Krama.

analyzed: guru pāda prasādena labhyate tat ca nā anyathā
translated: The vision of truth is obtained through the grace of the guru's feet, and not otherwise.

original: viśeṣasādhanā māyākāyasya viśeṣasādhanāyāḥ ādikarmikamāyākāyaviśuddhamāyākāyayuganaddhamāyākāyākhyāstrayo bhedāḥ ādikarmikasādhaneṣu sarvadharmeṣu viśleṣiteṣu satsu niḥsvabhāvahetunā pratyayena cotpannahetupratyayayorapi vajrakaṇādyutyuktibhiḥ pratipādanenāpi śūnyasya ca siddhirbhavati parañca savṛttāvastitvameteṣām /
analyzed: viśeṣa sādhanā māyā kāyasya viśeṣa sādhanāyāḥ ādi karmika māyā kāya viśuddha māyā kāya yuga naddha māyā kāya ākhyāḥ trayaḥ bhedāḥ ādi karmika sādhaneṣu sarva dharmeṣu viśleṣiteṣu satsu niḥsvabhāva hetunā pratyayena ca utpanna hetu pratyayayoḥ api vajrakaṇā dyuti uktibhiḥ pratipādanena api śūnyasya ca siddhiḥ bhavati param ca sa vṛttau astitvam eteṣām
translated: The special means of accomplishment are of three kinds: the beginner's illusory body, the pure illusory body, and the unified illusory body. In the means of accomplishment for beginners, when all phenomena are separated and exist, the accomplishment of emptiness also occurs through the cause of non-inherent nature and through the cause and conditions that arise, and through the teaching with the examples of a diamond particle and so forth. And these are established in reality.

analyzed: yat ca pratītyasamutpādaḥ
translated: And that which is dependent origination.

original: eva savṛtau vastūnā pratītyasamutpannasvarūpadharma eva māyākāyo vidyate /
analyzed: eva sa vṛtau vastūnā pratītyasamutpanna sva rūpa dharmaḥ eva māyā kāyaḥ vidyate
translated: In that way, in reality, only the illusory body, which is the nature of phenomena that arises dependently, exists.

analyzed: udāharaṇaiḥ etat māyā kāyaḥ pratipādyate
translated: This illusory body is taught through examples.

original: yathā ca bāhyārthābhāve'pi prakaṭitasvapnakāyaḥ pratyayāt prakaṭitā pratiśrutkā /
analyzed: yathā ca bāhya artha abhāve pi prakaṭita svapna kāyaḥ pratyayāt prakaṭitā pratiśrutkā
translated: And just as the illusory body appears even in the absence of external objects, the echo appears from the conditions.

analyzed: pratibimba ca
translated: And the reflection.

original: jale budubudākhyeṣu ābhāsiteṣu niḥsvabhāvamarīci indradhanuṣādika ca vicārya vastunaḥ kūṭasthatāsthiratāprabhṛtayaḥ vicāraṇīyāḥ /
analyzed: jale budubuda ākhyeṣu ābhāsiteṣu ca vicārya vastunaḥ kūṭastha tā sthira tā prabhṛtayaḥ vicāraṇīyāḥ
translated: And the bubbles in the water, which are manifested, are of no inherent nature, like a mirage, a rainbow, and so forth. The stability and firmness of the object should be examined.

analyzed: ādikarmika sādhakānām ayam eva sādhanā vidhiḥ
translated: This is the method of practice for beginners and practitioners.

original: sa ādarśasammukha vajrasatvasya likhitā viparītā pratikṛti rakṣati /
analyzed: vajra satvasya likhitā viparītā rakṣati
translated: That very image of Vajrasattva, drawn facing the mirror, is the counter-image that protects.

analyzed: yena ādarśe tat sarala dṛśyeta
translated: By which that [image] would be seen in the mirror.

analyzed: tathā eva eka manasā paśyantu
translated: In the same way, they should see with one-pointed mind.

original: pañcakrame cāpi rūpa ca vedanā caiva sajñā saskāra eva ca /
analyzed: pañcakrame ca api rūpa ca vedanā ca eva sajñā saskāraḥ eva ca
translated: And in the Five Stages, it is said: Form, feeling, perception, mental formations,

analyzed: vijñāna pañcama ca eva
translated: and consciousness as the fifth,

analyzed: catvāraḥ dhātavaḥ tathā
translated: and the four elements as well,

analyzed: akṣīṇi viṣayāḥ ca eva jñāna pañcakam eva ca
translated: the eyes and objects, and the five kinds of knowledge,

analyzed: adhyātma bāhyatas bhinna sarva māyā eva na anyathā
translated: are all indivisible as internal and external, all mere illusion, not otherwise.

analyzed: darpaṇa pratibimbena
translated: By the reflection in a mirror,

analyzed: māyā ādā iha ca lakṣyate
translated: the illusory body is indicated.

analyzed: itas ugre sarva sthāvara jaṅgamāni
translated: From here onwards, all stationary and moving beings,

analyzed: iṣṭadevasya mantra jñāna līlāyā pariśodhyante
translated: are purified by the mantra knowledge and play of the chosen deity.

analyzed: sāmānya toyam eva viśuddha māyā kāyaḥ
translated: This is the general pure illusory body.

original: viśeṣasya viśuddhamāyākāyasya ca gauṇapramukhau dvau bhedau yaśca tṛtīyacittavivekānantara prakaṭitayuganaddhakāyasya savṛtyaśo māyākāyo viśuddhamāyākāyaḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣasya viśuddha māyā kāyasya ca gauṇa pramukhau dvau bhedau yaḥ ca tṛtīya citta viveka anantara prakaṭita yuga naddha kāyasya māyā kāyaḥ viśuddha māyā kāyaḥ
translated: The pure illusory body has two specific divisions: the primary and the secondary. The illusory body with obscurations, which is manifested immediately after the third mental isolation, is the pure illusory body.

original: vyavahārabhedena kecid vidvāsaḥ prathamam aśuddha dvitīya ca viśuddhamāyākāya manyante /
analyzed: vyavahāra bhedena kecid manyante
translated: Some scholars, due to the difference in practice, consider the first body to be impure and the second to be the pure illusory body.

original: prathamasya kṛte ādarśe pratibimbitarūpamudāharanti dvitīya ca nirāvaraṇaskandha manyante /
analyzed: prathamasya kṛte ādarśe pratibimbita rūpam udāharanti dvitīya ca nirāvaraṇa skandha manyante
translated: For the first, they give the example of a reflected form in a mirror, and for the second, they consider the unobstructed aggregates.

original: etatsādhanā cittavivekenaiva hṛdayasthitānāhatabindau kṣityādidhātūnā sahāreṇa sārdha trijñānasahāyyena sampādyate /
analyzed: etad sādhanā citta vivekena eva hṛdaya sthita anāhatabindau kṣiti ādi dhātūnā sahāreṇa sārdha tri jñāna sahāyyena sampādyate
translated: And this accomplishment is achieved by the mind alone, through the separation of the mind, along with the elements such as earth, etc., which are located in the indestructible drop in the heart, with the assistance of the three knowledges.

original: upamāprabhāsvarāt pratilomato māyākāye utthitatattvameva yuganaddhamāyākāyasya sādhanā /
analyzed: upamā prabhāsvarāt pratilomataḥ māyā kāye utthita tattvam eva yuga naddha māyā kāyasya sādhanā
translated: The accomplishment of the unified illusory body is the very reality that arises from the illusory body in the reverse order from the example clear light.

original: avagaterūdgatiparivartanam bāhyābhyantaropāyānāśritya māyākāyasādhanayā sāka trijñānasahitasahajaprabhāsvarajñānena sarvaśūnyatāyāḥ pratyakṣīkaraṇāvadhau sādhakasyāvasthā māyākāyāt caturthakramasya paramārthaprabhāsvare parivartate /
analyzed: avagateḥ ūdgati parivartanam bāhya abhyantara upāyān āśritya māyā kāya sādhanayā tri jñāna sahita sahaja prabhāsvara jñānena sarva śūnyatāyāḥ pratyakṣīkaraṇa avadhau sādhakasya avasthā māyā kāyāt caturtha kramasya paramārtha prabhāsvare parivartate
translated: The stage of the practitioner, relying on the external and internal means, along with the three knowledges and the innate clear light knowledge, at the point of actualizing all emptiness through the practice of the illusory body, transforms from the illusory body to the ultimate clear light of the fourth stage.

analyzed: tadā sādhakaḥ darśana mārge praviśati
translated: At that time, the practitioner enters the path of seeing.

original: prabhāsvaraḥ viṣayimahāsukhajñānādeva viṣayaśūnyatāyāḥ abhinnaḥ satyābhisamayaḥ eva śaikṣikaḥ santatiyogaḥ /
analyzed: prabhāsvaraḥ viṣayi mahā sukha jñānāt eva viṣaya śūnyatāyāḥ abhinnaḥ satya abhisamayaḥ eva śaikṣikaḥ santati yogaḥ
translated: The luminous is non-different from the knowledge of great bliss with an object, and the true realization is the yogic practice of the trainee.

analyzed: idam eva paramārtha prabhāsvarasya arthāt caturtha krama prabhāsvarasya lakṣaṇam
translated: This is the definition of the ultimate luminous, the luminous of the fourth stage.

analyzed: vyutpattiḥ sahaja mahā sukha jñānam eva paramārtha prabhāsvaraḥ
translated: The innate knowledge of great bliss is the ultimate luminous.

original: tadabhimukhībhavane sati savṛteḥ arthāt aśeṣadvaitābhāsaprapañcasyānto jāyate /
analyzed: tad abhimukhībhavane sati sa vṛteḥ arthāt aśeṣa dvaita ābhāsa prapañcasya antaḥ jāyate
translated: When one faces that, the end of the entire net of appearances of duality is born.

analyzed: iyam advaya avasthā eva prabhāsvaraḥ
translated: This non-dual state itself is the luminous.

original: bhedaḥ viṣayiprabhāsvaraviṣayaprabhāsvaropamāprabhāsvaropameyaprabhāsvaraprabhṛtayo naike svarūpagatā bhedā vidhātu śakyante /
analyzed: bhedaḥ viṣayi prabhāsvara viṣaya prabhāsvara upamā prabhāsvara upameya prabhāsvara prabhṛtayaḥ na eke sva rūpa gatāḥ bhedāḥ vidhātu śakyante
translated: The distinctions such as the luminous with an object, the luminous without an object, the luminous simile, the luminous example, etc., many distinctions can be made regarding its nature.

analyzed: citta prakṛtiḥ yā āditas prabhāsvarā sā eva āśraya prabhāsvarā
translated: The nature of the mind, which is luminous from the beginning, is the luminous basis.

analyzed: ābhāsaḥ citta
translated: The appearance is the mind.

analyzed: citta ca sva savedya
translated: And the mind is self-cognizant.

analyzed: ca mahā sukham āste
translated: And the self-cognizant great bliss abides.

analyzed: mahāsukha śūnyatayā sārdham abhinnam asti
translated: The great bliss exists as non-different from emptiness.

original: sādhanā etatsākṣātkāraḥ vāyuyogena prakṛtisthairyeṇa ca vidhātu śakyate /
analyzed: sādhanā etad sākṣātkāraḥ vāyu yogena prakṛti sthairyeṇa ca vidhātu śakyate
translated: The means of realizing this are possible through the yoga of vāyu and the stability of prakṛti.

analyzed: etad anusāreṇa prabhāsvara sādhanāyāḥ śakyam
translated: In accordance with this, the two divisions of the means of realizing the luminous clarity are possible.
The realization of this is not possible through the churning of investigation.

original: yathā ca pāṇḍurogagrastena śakhādayaḥ pītāḥ dṛśyante parañca tadvarṇaḥ śvetaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca pāṇḍu roga grastena śakha ādayaḥ pītāḥ dṛśyante parañca tad varṇaḥ śvetaḥ
translated: And just as one afflicted with jaundice sees conches and so on as yellow and the color of that [conch] as white,

analyzed: lakṣaśas bodhanena api na avagamyate
translated: even after being told a hundred times, one does not perceive it as yellow or white.

analyzed: atas etad roga oṣadhi dvārā eva janasya upacāra upekṣyate
translated: Therefore, the treatment of the people is expected only through the medicine for that disease.

original: ācāryaraṅajuṅa dorjemahodayo'pi kathayati prabhāsvarasya sākṣātkāro buddhyā na sambhāvyate yathā kāṣṭhe agnisthitau satyā kāṣṭhadvayagharṣaṇenāpi tadutpādayitu śakyate /
analyzed: kathayati prabhāsvarasya sākṣātkāraḥ buddhyā na sambhāvyate yathā kāṣṭhe agni sthitau satyā kāṣṭha dvaya gharṣaṇena api tat utpādayitu śakyate
translated: The great teacher Rañjanu Dojre also says: The realization of the luminous clarity is not possible through the intellect. Just as when fire is present in wood, it can be produced even by rubbing two pieces of wood,

analyzed: na tu tad ati sūkṣma khaṇḍena
translated: but not by a very fine piece of it.

original: tathaiva lalanārasanayoryogena vāyoravadhūtyā praveśenaiva prabhāsvaraḥ sākṣātkriyate /
analyzed: tathā eva lalanā rasanayoḥ yogena vāyoḥ avadhūtyā praveśena eva prabhāsvaraḥ sākṣātkriyate
translated: In the same way, the luminous clarity is realized only through the yoga of the lips and tongue, by the inhalation of vāyu.
The explanation of which is given in the Vajra Recitation, Mind Isolation, and so on.

analyzed: tad vāyu yogasya atra api abhyāsaḥ vidheyaḥ
translated: The practice of that wind yoga should also be done here.

original: saprakṛtisthaprabhāsvarasya sākṣātkārasya dvitīyaḥ prakāraḥ etatsādhanāyāḥ svabhāvitamāyākāyasya śiraso'dhaḥ pādatalādārabhyopari dakṣiṇavāmādisarvadikṣu sahāreṇa sāka hṛdayakamale cittasthitikaraṇa piṇḍadhyānamasti /
analyzed: sa prakṛti stha prabhāsvarasya sākṣātkārasya dvitīyaḥ prakāraḥ etad sādhanāyāḥ sva bhāvita māyā kāyasya śirasaḥ ūdhaḥ pāda talāt ārabhya upari dakṣiṇa vāma ādi sarva dikṣu sahāreṇa sāka hṛdaya kamale citta sthiti karaṇa piṇḍa dhyānam asti
translated: The second method of the realization of the naturally luminous mind that abides with its essence is the meditation on the body, which is the natural body of illusion, starting from below the head and feet up to the heart lotus in all directions such as right and left, along with the support, for the sake of accomplishing that.

original: yathā darpaṇe śvāsapravartane sati tat kramaśaḥ bindau śūnye ca līyate tathaivātra dhyātavyam /🔽bhājana satvaloke /
analyzed: yathā darpaṇe śvāsa pravartane sati tat kramaśas bindau śūnye ca līyate tathā eva atra dhyātavyam  bhājana satva loke
translated: Just as when exhaling in a mirror, it gradually dissolves into the drop and the void, it should be meditated on in the same way here.🔽The world of beings is the vessel.

analyzed: ca sva prabhā āmaya kāye
translated: The world of beings is the body made of light.

original: prabhāmayakāya ca punaḥ pūrvavat sagṛhya prabhāsvare sthitikaraṇam anubhedadhyānamucyate /
analyzed: prabhā mayakāya ca punar pūrvavat sa gṛhya prabhāsvare sthiti karaṇam anubheda dhyānam ucyate
translated: And the body of light again, having been grasped as before, is said to be the meditation on the non-differentiation, which is the establishment of the mind in the luminous.

original: caturthadevīparipṛcchāvyākhyātantre etad vāyunā sārdha sayojya bhāvanā vidhātu samuktam /
analyzed: caturtha devī paripṛcchā vyākhyā tantre etat vāyunā sārdha sayojya bhāvanā vidhātu samuktam
translated: In the commentary on the question of the fourth goddess, this meditation is said to be connected with the wind.

original: yataśca piṇḍadhyānakāle sarvavāyavo bodhicitta ca hṛdaye sagrāhyāni bhavanti /
analyzed: yatas ca piṇḍa dhyāna kāle sarva vāyavaḥ ca hṛdaye sa grāhyāni bhavanti
translated: And at the time of the meditation on the body, all the winds and the bodhicitta are to be grasped in the heart.

analyzed: vāyu yogaḥ upi apekṣyate
translated: For this reason, the yoga of the wind is also required.

analyzed: bodhi citta abhiprāyaḥ utra prabhāsvara cittam eva  punar punar ubhaya dhyāna bhāvanāyāḥ paramārtha prabhāsvara tvam āvirbhavati
translated: The intention of the enlightened mind here is the luminous mind itself.🔽Again and again, the supreme reality of the luminous mind manifests through the cultivation of both types of meditation.

original: pratīyate yadābhyā sthitau paramārthaprabhāsvarasyāśrayakāyo'pi avipākakāyaḥ san māyākāya eva /
